Pictures

Above it all: NASA views of Earth at night

The International Space Station took this nighttime photograph of much of the eastern Atlantic coast of the United States. NASA
The population-heavy corridor between Philadelphia and Boston formed a near line, with Toronto (left edge), Montreal (near center) also shown. NASA
A very active Aurora Borealis (or the northern lights) was photographed from approximately 240 miles above Manitoba, Canada. NASA
The Las Vegas Strip (center) is reputed to be the brightest spot on Earth due to the concentration of lights associated with its hotels and casinos NASA
Aurora Australis (or the southern lights) was photographed with star streaks while the vehicle was over the South Pacific Ocean. NASA
Central and Eastern Europe as seen from the International Space Station. NASA

YouTube phenom PSY sorry for anti-US protests in 2004

The "Gangnam Style" rapper is apologizing to Americans for his participation in anti-US protests in South Korea. (AP)
  • Discuss Your take on 'Gangnam Style' singer's protest?

DA: Earlier cases against Wakefield's Burbine were too weak to prosecute

Prosecutors did not proceed with cases against John Burbine, 49, in 2005 or 2009 because because the victims and their families were "unwilling or unable" to help bring the matters to trial, an official said. (Boston Globe)
